{{Infobox national football team | Name = Italy Under-20 | Badge = | Badgesize = 125 px | Nickname = ''Azzurrini'' | Association = ''[[Italian Football Federation|''Federazione Italiana
Giuoco Calcio]]'' | Coach = {{flagicon|Italy}} [[Luigi Di Biagio]] | Captain = | Most caps = | Top scorer = | |pattern_la1= _ITA10h |pattern_b1= _ITA10h |pattern_ra1=_ITA10h |pattern_sh1=_ITA10a |pattern_so1=_thinwhitesides |leftarm1=0066bc |body1=000000 |rightarm1=0066bc |shorts1=FFFFFF |socks1=003cc3 |pattern_la2= _ITA10a |pattern_b2= _ITA10a |pattern_ra2= _ITA10a |pattern_so2= _thinsidesonwhite |pattern_sh2= _ITA10h |leftarm2=FFFFFF |body2=FFFFFF |rightarm2=FFFFFF |shorts2=0066bc |socks2=003cc3 | Regional name = [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]] | Regional cup apps = 5 | Regional cup first = [[1977 FIFA World Youth Championship|1977]] | Regional cup best = Quarter-final, 1987, 2005, 2009 }} '''Italy national under-20 football team''' is the national under-20 [[Association football|football]] team of [[Italy]] and is controlled by the [[Italian Football Federation]]. The team competes in the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]], which is held every two years. ==History== The U20 team is the ''de facto'' [[Italy national under-19 football team|under-19]] of the previous year, and it acts mainly as a feeder team for the U21s and provides further international development for youth players. The team qualified for its only official match, [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]], depends on U19 result. The U19 team finished runners-up of the [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]], thereby qualifying for the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. Any player may receive an U20 call-up regardless of whether they have played for the under-19 team. As the team mainly participate in friendly tournaments, overage players may also be selected. The team participated in an annual [[Italy/Germany/Switzerland under-20 Four Nations Tournament|Four Nations Tournament]] with Germany, Switzerland and Poland (in the past Austria or Netherlands), which was the main fixture of the U20 team. The team also have an annual fixture with the [[Serie D]] Best XI after the end of the season, since 2007 (except 2008 which U19 had ongoing competition{{cite news|url=http://www.lnd.it/index.php?page=user.news.selectNews&newsId=27524&ctl_level_id=21|title=A Orvieto si completa la grande festa del Top 11|date=2 June 2009|accessdate=27 July 2010|language=Italian|work=lnd.it/}}).{{cite news|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/calcio/lega_pro_serie_d/serie_d/2010/06/04-114537/Orvieto%2C+Top+11+a+testa+alta+contro+l%27Italia+Under+20|title=Orvieto, Top 11 a testa alta contro l'Italia Under 20|date=2010-06-04|accessdate=2010-06-05|work=Corriere dello Sport-Stadio|language=Italian}}{{cite news|url=http://www.seriednews.com/news_page.asp?ID_news=992|title=Top 11: sport e solidarietÃ |date=3 June 2008|accessdate=25 July 2010|work=Serie D News|language=Italian}}{{cite news|url=http://www.seriednews.com/news_page.asp?ID_news=737|title=La Top 11 Serie D Corriere dello Sport supera per 1 - 0 l'Under 20|date=31 May 2007|accessdate=25 July 2010|work=Serie D News|language=Italian}} The 2006 edition was played by Italy under-19 team, the ''de facto'' U20 team, which the U19 team already eliminated from the official competition and the team filled with overage player who non-eligible for [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2007 Euro]].{{cite news|url=http://www.seriednews.com/news_page.asp?ID_news=420|title=TOP 11 SERIE D - Nazionale Under 19: 2 - 0|date=1 June 2006|accessdate=25 July 2010|work=Serie D News|language=Italian}} ==FIFA U-20 World Cup Record== *[[1977 FIFA World Youth Championship|1977]]: 3rd in Group C *[[1979 FIFA World Youth Championship|1979]]: ''Did not qualify'' *[[1981 FIFA World Youth Championship|1981]]: 4th in Group B *[[1983 FIFA World Youth Championship|1983]]: ''Did not qualify'' *[[1985 FIFA World Youth Championship|1985]]: ''Did not qualify'' *[[1987 FIFA World Youth Championship|1987]]: Quarter-final *[[1989 FIFA World Youth Championship|1989]] to [[2003 FIFA World Youth Championship|2003]]: ''Did not qualify'' *[[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005]]: Quarter-final *[[2007 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2007]]: ''Did not qualify'' *[[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2009]]: Quarter-final *[[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2011]]: ''Did not qualify'' ==Current squad== Squad called up for the ''[[Four Nations Tournament]]'' match against [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland]] on 12 October 2011.{{cite news|url=http://www.figc.it/it/204/29781/2011/10/News.shtml|title=TORNEO 4 NAZIONI: DI BIAGIO HA SCELTO I 18 PER LA SFIDA ALLA POLONIA|date=8 October 2011|accessdate=9 October 2011|work=FIGC| language =Italian}} {{Nat fs g start}} {{Nat fs g player| no= | pos=GK | name=[[Alessandro Iacobucci]] | age={{birth date and age|1991|2|3|df=y}} | caps= | goals= | club=[[F.C.
